question: 蒸し返す
sourceMnemonic: You <kanji>steam</kanji> something to <kanji>return</kanji> it to its previously warm state. This is when you go <vocabulary>to reheat</vocabulary> something. But we usually use it to talk about bringing something up again and again in conversations or arguments. That's why it means <vocabulary>to rehash</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to bring up again</vocabulary>. You're bringing up memories from the past and steaming them up again.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>蒸れる</ja> and <ja>返す</ja>. Combine this knowledge to reheat your memories.
